snippet: In three hours of back-and-forth questioning, it appeared that neither side could take victory for granted in the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit, where the cases were heard.
abstract: Three-judge federal appeals panel in Cincinnati hears arguments in six same-sex marriage cases from four states, expressing skepticism about why gay rights advocates want to use courts to hasten an outcome that is gradually being won through elections and changes in attitude; all three judges refer repeatedly to transformed legal landscape of last year, and to expectation that Supreme Court will soon hear issue.
lead_paragraph: In three hours of back-and-forth questioning, it appeared that neither side could take victory for granted in the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit, where the cases were heard.

headline.main: One Court, Three Judges and Four States With Gay Marriage Cases
headline.print_headline: One Court, Three Judges and Four States With Gay Marriage Cases

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
